intro: Melicope rotundifolia, commonly known as the round-leaf melicope, is a small to medium-sized evergreen tree native to the Pacific Islands. It belongs to the Rutaceae family, which includes citrus and other aromatic plants. The plant is characterized by its rounded, leathery leaves and small, fragrant white flowers that bloom throughout the year. Its fruit is a round, fleshy drupe that contains a single seed. Melicope rotundifolia is often found in coastal and lowland forests, where it contributes to the biodiversity of its native ecosystems.
